      • add

        public static java.util.Calendar add(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                                     javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration)
        Adds the given XML duration to the given datetime.
        Parameters:
        calendar - The calendar to add the duration to.
        duration - The duration to be added.
        Returns:
        A new calendar representing the given calendar's time plus the given duration.

      • subtract

        public static java.util.Calendar subtract(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                                          javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration)
        Subtracts the given XML duration from the given datetime.
        Parameters:
        calendar - The calendar to subtract the duration from.
        duration - The duration to be subtracted.
        Returns:
        A new calendar representing the given calendar's time minus the given duration.

      • earlier

        public static java.util.Calendar earlier(javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration)
        Returns the current datetime minus the given duration.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration to be subtracted from the current datetime.
        Returns:
        The current datetime minus the given duration.

      • later

        public static java.util.Calendar later(javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration)
        Returns the current datetime plus the given duration.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.util.Calendar firstCalendar,
                          java.util.Calendar secondCalendar)
        Compares two datetimes.
        Parameters:
        firstCalendar - The first calendar to compare.
        secondCalendar - The second calendar to compare.
        Returns:
        Zero if both calendars represent that same instant in time, less than zero if the firstCalendar is an earlier instant in time than the secondCalendar, or greater than zero if the firstCalendar is greater than the secondCalendar.

      • duration

        public static javax.xml.datatype.Duration duration(java.util.Calendar startCalendar,
                                                   java.util.Calendar endCalendar)
        Returns the duration of time between two given Calendar objects.
        Parameters:
        startCalendar - The starting instant in time.
        endCalendar - The ending instant in time.
        Returns:
        The duration of time from the start instant to the end instant.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String input,
                                      java.lang.String inPattern,
                                      java.lang.String outPattern)
        Reformats the given datetime string according to the desired pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - The datetime string to be reformatted.
        inPattern - The pattern the given input datetime string adheres to.
        outPattern - The pattern the datetime string should be reformatted as.
        Returns:
        The given datetime string reformatted according to the given outPattern.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String input,
                                      java.lang.String inPattern,
                                      java.lang.String inTimeZone,
                                      java.lang.String outPattern,
                                      java.lang.String outTimeZone)
        Reformats the given datetime string according to the desired pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - The datetime string to be reformatted.
        inPattern - The pattern the given input datetime string adheres to.
        inTimeZone - The time zone ID identifying the time zone the given datetime string should be parsed in.
        outPattern - The pattern the datetime string should be reformatted as.
        outTimeZone - The time zone ID identifying the time zone the returned datetime string should be in.
        Returns:
        The given datetime string reformatted according to the given outPattern.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String input,
                                      java.lang.String inPattern,
                                      java.util.TimeZone inTimeZone,
                                      java.lang.String outPattern,
                                      java.util.TimeZone outTimeZone)
        Reformats the given datetime string according to the desired pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - The datetime string to be reformatted.
        inPattern - The pattern the given input datetime string adheres to.
        inTimeZone - The time zone the given datetime string should be parsed in.
        outPattern - The pattern the datetime string should be reformatted as.
        outTimeZone - The time zone the returned datetime string should be in.
        Returns:
        The given datetime string reformatted according to the given outPattern.

      • format
